l:dependency.name: miniOrange SAML
l:dependency.l:description: The Jenkins Plugins Parent POM Project

l:dependency.name: OpenWS
l:dependency.l:description: The OpenWS library provides a growing set of tools to work with web services at a low level. These tools include classes for creating and reading SOAP messages, transport-independent clients for connecting to web services, and various transports for use with those clients.

l:dependency.name: java-support
l:dependency.l:description: A POM containing properties, profiles, plugin configurations, etc. that are common across all Shibboleth V3 projects.

l:dependency.name: Apache Commons Lang
l:dependency.l:description: Apache Commons Lang, a package of Java utility classes for the classes that are in java.lang's hierarchy, or are considered to be so standard as to justify existence in java.lang.

l:dependency.name: Apache XML Security for Java
l:dependency.l:description: Apache XML Security for Java supports XML-Signature Syntax and Processing, W3C Recommendation 12 February 2002, and XML Encryption Syntax and Processing, W3C Recommendation 10 December 2002. As of version 1.4, the library supports the standard Java API JSR-105: XML Digital Signature APIs.

l:dependency.name: Commons Lang
l:dependency.l:description: Commons Lang, a package of Java utility classes for the classes that are in java.lang's hierarchy, or are considered to be so standard as to justify existence in java.lang.

l:dependency.name: ESAPI
l:dependency.l:description: The Enterprise Security API (ESAPI) project is an OWASP project to create simple strong security controls for every web platform. Security controls are not simple to build. You can read about the hundreds of pitfalls for unwary developers on the OWASP website. By providing developers with a set of strong controls, we aim to eliminate some of the complexity of creating secure web applications. This can result in significant cost savings across the SDLC.

l:dependency.name: XMLTooling-J
l:dependency.l:description: XMLTooling-J is a low-level library that may be used to construct libraries that allow developers to work with XML in a Java beans manner.

l:dependency.name: JSON in Java
l:dependency.l:description:
JSON is a light-weight, language independent, data interchange format. See http://www.JSON.org/
The files in this package implement JSON encoders/decoders in Java. It also includes the capability to convert between JSON and XML, HTTP headers, Cookies, and CDL.
This is a reference implementation. There is a large number of JSON packages in Java. Perhaps someday the Java community will standardize on one. Until then, choose carefully.
The license includes this restriction: "The software shall be used for good, not evil." If your conscience cannot live with that, then choose a different package.
The package compiles on Java 1.2 thru Java 1.4.

l:dependency.name: Stax2 API
l:dependency.l:description: tax2 API is an extension to basic Stax 1.0 API that adds significant new functionality, such as full-featured bi-direction validation interface and high-performance Typed Access API.

l:dependency.name: Joda-Time
l:dependency.l:description: Date and time library to replace JDK date handling

l:dependency.name: OpenSAML-J
l:dependency.l:description: The OpenSAML-J library provides tools to support developers working with the Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML).

l:dependency.name: Apache Commons Collections
l:dependency.l:description: Types that extend and augment the Java Collections Framework.

l:dependency.name: Woodstox
l:dependency.l:description: Woodstox is a high-performance XML processor that implements Stax (JSR-173) and SAX2 APIs

l:dependency.name: FindBugs-jsr305
l:dependency.l:description: JSR305 Annotations for Findbugs

l:dependency.name: Streaming API for XML
l:dependency.l:description: StAX is a standard XML processing API that allows you to stream XML data from and to your application.

l:license.name: COMMON DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION LICENSE (CDDL) Version 1.0

l:dependency.name: Guava: Google Core Libraries for Java
l:dependency.l:description:
Guava is a suite of core and expanded libraries that include utility classes, google's collections, io classes, and much much more.
Guava has only one code dependency - javax.annotation, per the JSR-305 spec.

l:dependency.name: Apache Commons Codec
l:dependency.l:description: The Apache Commons Codec package contains simple encoder and decoders for various formats such as Base64 and Hexadecimal. In addition to these widely used encoders and decoders, the codec package also maintains a collection of phonetic encoding utilities.

l:dependency.name: jsoup Java HTML Parser
l:dependency.l:description: jsoup is a Java library for working with real-world HTML. It provides a very convenient API for extracting and manipulating data, using the best of DOM, CSS, and jquery-like methods. jsoup implements the WHATWG HTML5 specification, and parses HTML to the same DOM as modern browsers do.

l:dependency.name: Apache Velocity
l:dependency.l:description: Apache Velocity is a general purpose template engine.

l:dependency.name: Not Yet Commons SSL
l:dependency.l:description: A Java SSL component library
